Bag O' Links - 18/9/2009 Elad Meidar

19 Sep 2009

  • Turning prospects into Clients – Will all want more money don’t we?.
  • Designing iPhone Interfaces – some tips on how to design your next iPhone application.
  • Essential storage tradeoff – Simple reads vs. Simple writes – Normalizing data ftw.
  • CSS only drop down menu – No JS at all.
  • jCryption – encrypt HTML forms – javascript HTML-Form encryption plugin, which encrypts the POST/GET-Data that will be sent when you submit a form.
  • HTML5 blog site walkthrough – new tags, new fun.
  • iPhone JSON over HTTP – This tutorial provides a step-by-step howto for consuming JSON web services from an iPhone app.
  • Ruby on Rails linux server setup – looks very very comprehensive, i really need to create a matching Automation script to make it automagically awesome.
  • ActiveRecord normalization plugin – as it’s name suggests, it’s a normalization plugin.
  • Cassandra and Ruby – seems like a very VERY useful new win.
  • Paperclip before_post_process – mrkris suggest a neat way to bypass paperclip’s post processing (resizing for ex) using a simple before callback.
  • Manage prerequisites in Rails – Daniel suggests an awesome way to manage prerequisites.

GitHub Treasures

  • friendly_id – the “Swiss Army bulldozer” of slugging and permalink plugins for ActiveRecord. It allows you to create pretty URL’s and work with human-friendly strings as if they were numeric ids for ActiveRecord models.
  • file_store_expires_in – Adds a :expires_in option to Rails filestore caching, in line with memcached store. Providing a very easy way to add high capacity caching to a site.
  • stale_fish – keep file fixtures (canned responses) current in your application.
